6339E56BBB8046B4B79E1FBF02597BE2.description: Research career pathways in vocal jazz and music in general.

B61AA2A83CF34ACF83599BA6AFF1D590.description: Describe the different peoples that made up the culture of New Orleans at the start of the 20th century and the ways that these cultures influenced the development of jazz. Are there parallels in Canada?

FDAD0A76D723482EBE1EF16A659399D6.description: Identify the influence of vocal jazz in Canadian musical culture (e.g., Was jazz ever the "pop" music in Canada?).

CDCBB125B1FB4720AAAAD046C0902197.description: Discuss the influence of vocal jass on other types of music, with an emphasis on the music of Canada and Saskatchewan and assess possible careers in vocal jazz and music.

506E9D4E92FE4B1DA10515BD2EB10064.description: Discuss the influence of jazz (and other musics) on contemporary First Nations music.

10D78986555D4B709D9255FDE7806D92.description: A number of vocal jazz artists have First Nations or America Indian heritage (e.g., Mildred Bailey, Lena Horne, Joe Williams and Juila Keefe). Discuss possible resons why their heritage is not widely known.

0BECCAAE6DD14719B2399A411A2B7B15.description: Identify the most influential jazz sings (e.g., Ella Fitzgerald, Frank Sinatra). Investigate why these performers are identified as influentional and listen to their music.

C702EF24EF2447E28DA7947E3C86BD52.description: Develop a jaz history timeline from about 1890 through the present, including developments in jazz music, major figures and styles along with important world historical events.

126655D5161D473CBE5CAF643FEB27E2.description: Demonstrate an awareness of key historical and artist developments and trends as the relate to the eras and styles of vocal jazz.

71CE600CF4DF4119BA7E14A392EF0961.description: Discuss aspects of vocal jazz such as history, performers, styles and eras through a variety of media, with a focus on Canadian or Saskatchewan jazz artists.

48BC30408F2D4FDFB014AEC9336DDF09.description: As a group, listen to recording of vocal jazz, develop a list or understanding of the basic characteristics of different jazz styles, genres, periods and place and implement that knowledge into practice and performance.

32F742D178AA438DB11E8FF7D25BEE07.description: Explore the different eras, genres, styles and feels of vocal jazz through listening to and.or performing the representative music.

63FC4A5976C247BBB5CF6D32BE4C988E.description: Cultural/Historical (CH) Goal: Students will investigate the content and aesthetics of the arts within cultural, historical, and contemporary contexts, and understand the connection between the arts and the human experience.

E9360C60002C407DBAE858F77DDC078A.description: Know the value of individual practive, know how to practice, conduct an ongoing evaluation of the student;s personal practice skills and implement a plan for improvement.

9668ED1FC9BB4284A12DF50FE248F21D.description: With assistance, critically examine and assess the student's individual work and personal contribution to group projects/performances.

954F4304559447A3B34F3375423CB9B8.description: Show respect for the personal work of self and others through appropriate critique.

5B5E3AB050DE42D9B1ADC7C882DCB557.description: Begin to apply the learned characteristics of different styles, eras, etc. to the performance of the student's music.

6145C241326E499ABC5730659BF5D917.description: Identify the components of a professional attitude towards conduct, focus and communication skills in rehearsal, preparation of materials and presentation of products.

53C44813EADD4938BB97F926655EBA0B.description: Discuss the challenges and importance of singing in tune with good balance and tone and learn the capabilities of the student's own voice (e.g., range, where the break in the student's voice is).

C706CC21FC27463A8C95E393C28305D2.description: With assistance, identify the importance of and begin to implement, melodic phrasing, rhythmic accuracy and articulation in perparation and performance of vocal jazz.

D5F79A24331C4720AEC2E7A5D477E5BC.description: Explore the role of each of the parts within the student's ensemble by demonstrating the ability to perform those specific tasks that are particular to the vocal part or instrument that the student sings or plays in the ensemble (e.g., bass part in the choir, comping for guitar and piano, walking lines for the bass, solo parts in the choir and position in a section).

696634A852C6441F99894048C10BED0B.description: Describe the skills, techniques and attitudes necessary for successful ensemble performace.

574DC70D5BC84694858E054822D1175B.description: Recognize and discuss the value of original thought, technical proficiency, place, era and other concepts in the music of the great jazz performers.

455CE5BED20F419A9DD51AC3844FF781.description: Explore the skills and components of listening actively, continue to develop these listening skill and recognize that listening contributes to the authenticity of performances.

D7C0E1426F6A4CC7AF8E3EE4CAC6C4A1.description: When listening to a musical selection, as a group develop the ability to describe and classify the music using appropriate jazz language (e.g., style, period, compose, culture and performer).

361ADFBAEF1A478BBACB197CC77BDD44.description: In groups, design and implement a plan for improvement (personal and ensemble) based on the criteria generated from listening to the great performers.

A296E0DB2D4A4A79A68F9E0CDF487184.description: Generate criteria of excellence through listening to the music of the great performers (e.g., What is it that makes the music great? what do the great performers do that the student or student's ensemble does no do?)

D0019A32E4A7469F967EF2FC3C457E61.description: Listen to the music of the great jazz and vocal jazz performers.

0F4A6881C122485E995674C4135A4591.description: Listen to performances of vocal jazz music and with assistance, develop and apply critical criteria to use in critical exaluation of one's own work and other's work.

36A80095BD6A495F922E197C59B8516C.description: Develp strategies for hearing 2 and 4 on first hearing a piece of music in an appropriate time signature.

E940016F6184498795FD921D0C0E4333.description: Develop strategies to identify the types of scales being used (pentatonic, blues, major, etc.) in music performed and/or listened to.

83BD9CC1D8FD4DD9BF075A445C8B04DD.description: Create strategies to identify the time signature on first hearing a piece of music, in simpler time signatures such as 2/4, 3/4, 4/4.

2EE201F10C00407895B490E2402B97D4.description: Examine common chord structures such as triads in music performed and/or listened to.

2D6F3EE41C3445F6885B5EEFC4C7F633.description: In groups, identify, discuss and apply strategies to solve different challenges related to music making.

B3441CEEBA2E40A8AFC5425DFE371B88.description: Identify the skills and abilities to analyze vocal jazz music in real time while making or listening to the music.

4E767F5D4F0F44B496E4B955B398608D.description: Discuss the history, cultural heritage and effect of current events as these apply to the musical selection.

BC3B74174E584482A0403E87BCED7ADC.description: Listen to music analyzing and reflecting on the melody, other voices, bass line, drums and percussion, background lines, background vocals, roots and chord progression and sing with the recording.

82F911661DA34CF3AC33CEBD63462D88.description: Analyze and reflect on just one voice or instrument from the beginning to the end of a musical selection (e.g., Does the singer or player perform the same way all the way through? How was it different or the same? What did he/she sing or play that the student also might be able to sing or play?)

4D4ABC9FC38746FDAB8E1F4624A7F5D2.description: In groups, analyze the characteristic sounds, licks, tone and other elements of well-known singers and/or groups. Identify these singers and/or groups. Identify these singers and/or groups on recordings aurally, only by listening to the characteristic sounds or ideas presented in the music.

B2C4B09206C34B9596DC564597DEF606.description: Analyze the development of the jazz music(melody, arrangement, changes, or improvisation) as a whole or in smaller sections.

A864AE93E7B5432492C7CF5DF4E6717A.description: Listen to jazz music and with assistance analyze form, tone, style, era, dynamics, articulation, time signature, characteristic rhythms, time, balance, blend, key, monde and/or pitch.

353D127059E64BC48A104965D3F1EDFA.description: Identify skills and abilities necessary to listen to a jazz performer.

A94462215FAE47C7B0EB936C31D23D67.description: Know, predict and/or anticipate what is next or might bve next in the music and prepare for that while performing in the moment of the music.

9D3B5244E4D5496C84FDD47706076DE0.description: Know any special emotional context that may apply to the music, generate the appropriate emotional feeling or energy and/or synchronize the personal emotional state of the performer with the emotional context of the music being performed.

C8339056B529425C8DAEC1A660331F1D.description: Recall previous experiences and knowledge (in music and in life) and integrate these into solo group vocal jazz performances.

26E85B75B2904A03B042709A6289A115.description: Know the history, culture, style, form and tempo of the music being performed and respond to the music by reading it and/or performing the notes and/or changes appropriately

0CD863FBE26C4F1993D9DD4DEEAF7C5D.description: React to the audience, their presence (or nor), body language, expressions and reaction to the music (e.g., applause, cheering, being asked to sing louder or quieter).

963303346D2947DFA00934AEB15CE06B.description: Listen to the acoustic properties of the performing space, including the sound, tone, loudness, and reverb of the room and adjust singing and microphone technique accordingly.

031BD90672FD41969B3A323ED0CD268E.description: Respond to the conductor/leader, including gestures, cues, tempo, expressions and body language.

CE0B6046B4ED468AB34C69992EC77443.description: Immediately respond to the ensemble's response (e.g., When singing, does the student match and change vowel sounds and shapes to match the group?).

3423DEC30BED4D25AFD769C2D7C5D2F0.description: Respond to the rest of the ensemble (e.g., its tone, colour, pitch, dynamics, style, rhythm, time, balance, consistent vowel use and blend).

9047E690EFF9453D8859255850AC83A7.description: Respond to qualities of personal tone such as pitch, dynamics, style, colour, blend, rhythm, time, and consistent vowel use.

8486849BB1F8407DA4BE45661478AC4C.description: Identify the skills and abilities required to listen and respond as a vocal jazz performer when singing jazz.

AEA9C02E5E5B46B290D96B03F01A6153.description: Critical/Responsive (CR) Goal: Students will respond to artistic expressions of Saskatchewan, Canadian, and International artists using critical thinking, research, creativity, and collaborative inquiry.

84136FB36D7541F8ACDFA1E22B51650C.description: Compare and contrast vocal jazz style to other vocal styles.

0947DC63811F4DB08969349D96A70109.description: Sight-read a melodic line written in stepwise motions

4BF27EE6A4E545B18700EA892B6FBDE4.description: Sing a jazz standard (with recorded or live acoompaniment) exploring scat singin and other appropriate jazz stylings.

80D3C239FE93453F85EC579E96C9EBBE.description: Sing the chord tones of major and minor triads and scale triads.

3A9E770274AF4B908E61461F4ED1D1B9.description: Sing a one octave chromatic scale, scending and descending, unaccompanied

430E1EAE8C844B7896FD7787B360F86A.description: Sing a known tune(e.g., O'Canada) a cappella maintaining key centre.

267139BF3CE746A5A3F5BAFC0BBC32A6.description: Establish the key concepts related to singing expressively (e.g., work painting, phrasing, motion and dynamics). Show the knowledge of these concepts through singing.

429DB0C23F2C4B75BE5AE923A4ED5488.description: Describe the connection betrween the breath and the voice.

A6F9FC79A11E430197802ADDB50D31AF.description: Recognize a vocal tone appropriate to the style and personal development.

CFA04839343148B6BB654F43F551A371.description: Identify personal vocal techniques and apply these to create or show a musical product.

2000469026CC45609FB2011F51532F6A.description: Identify different elements of music such as articulation, rhythm, beat, metre, time placement and tone that help create a jazz style and apply this knowledge while music making.

20381A3A19A34139BA1EC4EF7444B2F4.description: In groups, design, implement and evaluate a plan to improve individual performance and to enhance the knowledge and uderstanding of vocal jazz. As part of this process of improvement, include recording and listening back to performances, practices and/or rehearsals.

38EBAD3E0D4D4FB5837580F5739A8C82.description: Describe the relationship of form and text in music, particularly blues and ABA, AABA song forms.

32CD06E39A4A45AEA4681F7AA209DBE9.description: Sing a variety of vocal jazz styles (e.g., swing, funk, ballad) accompanied and a cappella.

B5BDAB4E9D3748F08D42B387A94B6EBE.description: Demonstrate the knowledge of standard notation conventions (e.g., note durations up to eighth notes, repeats, codas, D.S.s and dynamic markings). Identify jazz conventions that differ from traditional classical notation (e.g., falls, glisses, slides, inflection marks and hats).

6D0BC0CBF19B4130B2F1334FA2D3F5D4.description: Identify the elements of music and apply these to create a musical product.

BD4B8E384BD44A818B073B21A2E2B89B.description: Recognize jazz vocabulary and use this vocabulary to describe personal musical practise, learning, theory and performance.

60DAF7AFB1374200860A4026249A568A.description: Examine the conventions regarding jazz articulation and use those conventions in performance.

6DE3442EA2CF4365809CE3FE3CEA896C.description: Explore text through creating original text to pre-existing melodies and improvisations (vocalese)

4BF4F30C3FBF44A3B8B84A23B8432E8A.description: Model through performance and/or instruct through sectionals, a deep understanding of the musical text. This may include: demonstrating phrasing; describing the historical context/meaning of the text; using proper syllabic emphasis; bringing out important words in the text; connecting the music or melody to the text; describing the cultural significance of the text; telling a story with the music and text; and comparing and contrasting vocal jazz style to other vocal styles.

4E4D4FED8D094C6EA615ADF7B48CF2B2.description: Prepare, rehearse and perform music in jazz style in solo, small group and/or large ensemble settings.

31224CBF52354CA0850AE6DE390DAB87.description: Recognize, with assistance as necessary, the importance of musical text in personal musical performance.

FC43F03CB6DB49AABEC4C11ED5DC1FD3.description: Take personal and musical risks by trying new ways to express oneself in the jazz idiom, using new ides, new concepts and a variety of styles.

8A0EB26B80B54C09AB4052740422C81D.description: Demonstrate improvement and growth in the presentation and construction of improvised solos in a performance setting.

4A887CC692FE48AA81ACF1AA3864644D.description: With assistance create simple, short, three or four note jazz ideas and develop these licks by methods such as: sequencing; transforming(manipulating critical notes in a phrase to suit chord changes); adding single notes to the original lick(passing tones, approach tones, etc.) -ornamenting the lick; and stylizing licks by adding turns falls, scoops, etc.

BB37A9A206F94797A05D795AD477B4A7.description: Sing and/or transcribe music through methods such as: call and response with the teacher (or other students); singing roots of the chord progression of the song; singing blues heads and simple jazz tunes by ear; singing colour tones (thirds and sevenths, ninths) over blues progressions; singing a solo using a single scale or mode (blues, dorian, major etc); and singing and/or playing along with recordings of solos

B06D5CC4374346AA834A5A4E618D0C61.description: Discuss understanding of jazz style and analyze musical events within a solo or composition(e.g. introduction, shout chorus, form, dynamics, pitches, changes, articulation).

AED6ECBE906F42AB82E773A12540B843.description: Impovising in a jazz style, exploring understanding of applicable jazz theory.

78CE62985FB7443C990523F2ABA7F415.description: Creative/Productive (CP) Goal: Students will inquire, create, and communicate through dance, drama, music and visual art.
